treatment.reference: Isolation and characterization of a new coccoid methanogen, Methanogenium tatii spec. nov. from a solfataric field on Mount Tatio Arch Microbiol 137:308-315
treatment.description: Regular or highly irregular cells, depending on the salt concentration in the medium. Average size 3 µm in diameter, peritrichous flagellated. Cells are Gram negative and the cell envelope is composed of hexagonal protein subunits, which seem to contain a glycoprotein of MW = 120,000. DNA base composition: 54 mol% G + C. Growth temperatures: 25-45˚C, optimum between 37-40˚C. Optimal salt concentration: 0.1 M NaCl. Growth and methane production on H2:CO2 and formate. 0.5% yeast extract, 0.5% peptone and acetate are required for optimal growth. Yeast extract and peptone can partially be replaced by a heavy metal solution. Found in solfataric pools at an altitude of 4750 m. No growth on acetate, methanol, ethanol, ethyl acetate, dimethylamine, and trimethylamine. Type strain: DSM 2702.
